intro: Cyphostemma sarcospathulum, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, followed by berry-like fruits that are yellow when mature. It is often found in rocky habitats and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. The species is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in some indigenous communities.
